info.title: Personalized Offers
info.description: This API provides content for financial instutions participating in Mastercard Personalized Offers to use in online and mobile banking applications for cardholders.

post.summary: Make Statement Credit Offer Available Redeemable
post.description: This resource is used to make a statement credit offer available for redemption.

parameters.name: FId
parameters.description: Financial Institution Identifier. Code that specifies the platform and configuration instance, provided by Mastercard during implementation.

parameters.name: UserToken
parameters.description: Session identifier as returned by the UserToken resource.

parameters.name: OfferId
parameters.description: System-wide identifier for the campaign, not intended for end-user display.

200.description: This resource returns information about the activated offer.

get.description: This resource returns offers that are available to the user and conform to the search criteria (if specified).

parameters.name: FId
parameters.description: Financial Institution Identifier. Code that specifies the platform and configuration instance, provided by Mastercard during implementation.

parameters.name: UserToken
parameters.description: Session identifier as returned by the UserToken resource.

parameters.name: Lang
parameters.description: When utilized with a multi-lingual implementation, may be the tongue and country of the user in ISO 639-1, underscore, ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.

parameters.name: MerchantName
parameters.description: Fuzzy term to search retailers with offers for the user. In general, searching of Matched Offers is not advised as users generally have a modest selection of highly relevant promotions.

parameters.name: Category
parameters.description: Offer Categories.

parameters.name: OfferType
parameters.description: The kind of deal. POSTPAIDCREDIT- Statement Credit Offer, which is a discount that is automatically applied to the card linked to the user and utilized to make the purchase.

parameters.name: PageNumber
parameters.description: Segment of offers to return.

parameters.name: ItemsPerPage
parameters.description: Segment size of offer to be returned. Default is 25.

200.description: This resource returns offers that are available to the user and conform to the search criteria (if specified).

get.description: This resource returns extended information for the requested offer, typically used to display a detail view.

parameters.name: FId
parameters.description: Financial Institution Identifier. Code that specifies the platform and configuration instance, provided by Mastercard during implementation.

parameters.name: UserToken
parameters.description: Session identifier as returned by the UserToken resource.

parameters.name: OfferId
parameters.description: System-wide identifier for the campaign, not intended for end-user display.

200.description: This resource returns extended information for the requested offer, typically used to display a detail view.

get.description: This resource returns offers that have been fulfilled by the user.

parameters.name: FId
parameters.description: Financial Institution Identifier. Code that specifies the platform and configuration instance, provided by Mastercard during implementation.

parameters.name: UserToken
parameters.description: Session identifier as returned by the UserToken resource.

parameters.name: Lang
parameters.description: When utilized with a multi-lingual implementation, may be the tongue and country of the user in ISO 639-1, underscore, ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.

parameters.name: PageNumber
parameters.description: Segment of offers to return.

parameters.name: ItemsPerPage
parameters.description: Segment size of offer to be returned. Default is 25.

200.description: This resource returns offers that have been fulfilled by the user.

get.summary: Returns Information About Redeemable Postpaid Credit Offer
get.description: This resource returns extended information about the specified activated postpaid credit offer.

parameters.name: FId
parameters.description: Financial Institution Identifier. Code that specifies the platform and configuration instance, provided by Mastercard during implementation.

parameters.name: UserToken
parameters.description: Session identifier as returned by the UserToken resource.

parameters.name: ActivationId
parameters.description: Distinct identifier for the offer being available for redemption by the user as returned by Activate Statement Credit Offer or Redeemed Offers, not intended for end-user display.

200.description: This resource returns extended information about the specified activated postpaid credit offer.

post.description: This resource allows a user to provide a thumbs-up or a thumbs-down rating of the specified offer. Offer matches that are disliked will be supressed from the results of future calls to Matched Offers.

parameters.name: FId
parameters.description: Financial Institution Identifier. Code that specifies the platform and configuration instance, provided by Mastercard during implementation.

parameters.name: UserToken
parameters.description: Session identifier as returned by the UserToken resource.

parameters.name: OfferId
parameters.description: System-wide identifier for the campaign, not intended for end-user display.

parameters.name: Feedback
parameters.description: User response to the offer. 0- Dislike offer. 1- Like offer.

200.description: This resource returns the user rating of the specified offer.

get.description: This resource returns the accumulated and potential savings for a Personalized Offers user.

parameters.name: FId
parameters.description: Financial Institution Identifier. Code that specifies the platform and configuration instance, provided by Mastercard during implementation.

parameters.name: UserToken
parameters.description: Session identifier as returned by the UserToken resource.

200.description: This resource returns the accumulated and potential savings for a Personalized Offers user.

get.description: This resource creates the user session. It must be called prior to any other API calls for the specified user. The Token value does not expire.

parameters.name: FId
parameters.description: Financial Institution Identifier. Code that specifies the platform and configuration instance, provided by Mastercard during implementation.

parameters.name: AuthInfo
parameters.description: Authorization Information. AES 128-bit encrypted concatenation of "User ID as specified in enrollment:FI ID as provided by Mastercard:current Unix time". Key exchange and establishment of maintenance procedures occur during implementation.

200.description: This resource returns the user session token (UserToken), which is a required input to all other API resources.

CurrencyCode.description: ISO 4217 code in which the redeeming transaction must be made to qualify for the offer.

MaxCashback.description: The most cash back which a user can earn for the offer.

MinTransactionAmountToRedeem.description: The smallest purchase amount that will qualify for redemption.

StatementCreditType.description: Calculation kind of the redemption value. SPEND_CASH/VISIT_CASH- fixed value. SPEND_PERCENTAGE/VISIT_PERCENTAGE- share value.

VisitThreshold.description: The number of purchases required to qualify for redemption.

ReasonCode.description: This will identify the reason for the error.

Source.description: This is the unique identifier that attempts to define the field in error when available.  If a specific field can't be identified System will be returned.

ActiveSc.description: ACTIVATED_STATEMENT_CREDIT- ready for redemption by the user. AVAILABLE- requires call to Activate Statement Credit Offer to make ready for redemption.

CurrencyCode.description: ISO 4217 code in which the redeeming transaction must be made to qualify for the offer.

Discount.description: The markdown represented by the offer, in absolute value or percentage.

DiscountType.description: The kind of markdown represented by the offer. ABSOLUTE- fixed amount. PERCENTAGE- share of purchase.

EventEndDate.description: Last day that redemption can be made.

EventStartDate.description: First day that redemption can be made by any user, may not apply to the specified user.

Headline.example: Shop at Example.com and get 20% back on purchase of $25 or more

MerchantImageURL.description: Square picture of the retailer logo.

OfferId.description: System-wide identifier for the campaign, not intended for end-user display.

OfferSource.description: Platform that made the offer available, not intended for end-user display.

OfferType.description: The kind of deal. POSTPAIDCREDIT- Statement Credit Offer, which is a discount that is automatically applied to the card linked to the user and utilized to make the purchase.

RedemptionMode.description: Type of credit made upon redemption of the offer- CASH, POINTS, or EITHER.

ShortDescription.description: Summary of the deal, typically displayed beneath the headline in a list view.
ShortDescription.example: On your next purchase of $25 or more at Example.com online or at a store, receive 20% back posted to the card associated with this account.

CurrentPage.description: Count of current offer return segment.

ItemsPerPage.description: Count of offers in the returned segment.

TotalCount.description: Count of all offers available for criteria.

Category.description: The type of retailer to which the offer applies.

Name.description: Display name for the retailer to which the offer applies.

StoreLocatorUrl.description: Web page where retailer outlets can be found.

WebsiteUrl.description: The internet address of the retailer.

CurrencyCode.description: ISO 4217 code in which the redeeming transaction must be made to qualify for the offer.

EventEndDate.description: Last day that redemption can be made.

EventStartDate.description: First day that redemption can be made by any user, may not apply to the specified user.

Headline.example: Shop at Example.com and get 20% back on purchase of $25 or more

LongDescription.description: Explanation of the deal, typically displayed beneath the headline in a detail view. Often the same as the ShortDescription.
LongDescription.example: On your next purchase of $30 or more at Example.com online or at a store, receive $10.00 back posted to the card associated with this account.

OfferId.description: System-wide identifier for the campaign, not intended for end-user display.

OfferSource.description: Platform that made the offer available, not intended for end-user display.

OfferType.description: The kind of deal. POSTPAIDCREDIT- Statement Credit Offer, which is a discount that is automatically applied to the card linked to the user and utilized to make the purchase.

RedemptionMode.description: Type of credit made upon redemption of the offer- CASH, POINTS, or EITHER.

RedemptionType.description: Where a purchase may be made to qualify for the offer- INSTORE, ONLINE, or ONLINE-INSTORE (either).

ShortDescription.description: Summary of the deal, typically displayed beneath the headline in a list view.
ShortDescription.example: On your next purchase of $25 or more at Example.com online or at a store, receive 20% back posted to the card associated with this account.

DetailedTerms.description: Conditions required for successful redemption of the offer.
DetailedTerms.example: Offer is non-transferable and applies to one purchase of a min. of $30 online or in store charged to your card by the expiration date.

AltText.description: Description of a picture or graphic that may be displayed along with the offer information.

Description.description: Verbal details of the image, may be used for accessiblity.

ImageUrl.description: A picture or graphic that may be displayed along with the offer information.

ActivationDate.description: Day on which the offer became ready for redemption.

ActivationId.description: Distinct identifier for the offer being available for redemption by the user, not intended for end-user display.

CurrencyCode.description: ISO 4217 code in which the redeeming transaction must be made to qualify for the offer.

EventEndDate.description: Last day that redemption can be made.

EventStartDate.description: First day that redemption can be made.

Headline.example: Shop at Example.com and get 20% back on purchase of $25 or more

LongDescription.description: Explanation of the deal, typically displayed beneath the headline in a detail view. Often the same as the ShortDescription.
LongDescription.example: On your next purchase of $30 or more at Example.com online or at a store, receive $10.00 back posted to the card associated with this account.

MaxUserRedemptions.description: The number of times that the cardholder may take advantage of this offer.

OfferId.description: System-wide identifier for the campaign, not intended for end-user display.

OfferSource.description: Platform that made the offer available, not intended for end-user display.

OfferType.description: The kind of deal. POSTPAIDCREDIT- Statement Credit Offer, which is a discount that is automatically applied to the card linked to the user and utilized to make the purchase.

RedemptionMode.description: Type of credit made upon redemption of the offer- CASH, POINTS, or EITHER.

RedemptionType.description: Where a purchase may be made to qualify for the offer- INSTORE, ONLINE, or ONLINE-INSTORE (either).

ShortDescription.description: Summary of the deal, typically displayed beneath the headline in a list view.
ShortDescription.example: On your next purchase of $30 or more at Example.com inline or at a store, receive $10.00 back posted to the card associated with this account.

Category.description: The type of retailer to which the offer applies, not intended for end-user display.

Name.description: Display name for the retailer to which the offer applies.

StoreLocatorUrl.description: Web page where retailer outlets can be found.

WebsiteUrl.description: The internet address of the retailer.

CurrentPage.description: Count of current offer return segment.

ItemsPerPage.description: Count of offers in the returned segment.

TotalCount.description: Count of all offers available for criteria.

ActivationDate.description: Day on which the offer became ready for redemption.

ActivationId.description: Distinct identifier for the offer being available for redemption by the user, not intended for end-user display.

CashBack.description: Value earned upon fulfillment of offer conditions, not applicable to points activations.

DaysRemaining.description: Number of days until the offer expires.

Headline.example: Shop at Example.com and get $10.00 back on purchase of $30 or more

Merchant.description: Display name for the retailer to which the offer applies.

OfferId.description: System-wide identifier for the campaign, not intended for end-user display.

PointsEarned.description: Value earned upon fulfillment of offer conditions, not applicable to cash activations.

RedemptionEndDate.description: Last day on which a purchase will qualify for the offer.

RedemptionMode.description: Type of credit made upon redemption of the offer- CASH or POINTS.

RemainingSpend.description: Purchase amount still required to redeem the offer.

ShortDescription.description: Summary of the deal, typically displayed beneath the headline in a list view.
ShortDescription.example: On your next purchase of $30 or more at Example.com inline or at a store, receive $10.00 back posted to the card associated with this account.

Status.description: Disposition of offer- ACTIVATED, REDEEMED, CREDIT_DECLINED.

TotalSpend.description: Count of purchases user made to redeem the offer.

EarnedCashback.description: Value of postpaid credit deal redemptions.

NumAvailable.description: Count of postpaid credit deals that are ready for activation or redemption.

NumRedeemed.description: Count of postpaid credit deals redeemed.

PotentialSavings.description: Minimum value of unredeemed postpaid credit deals.

CashBackEarned.description: Value earned upon fulfillment of offer conditions, not applicable to points activations.

PointsEarned.description: Value earned upon fulfillment of offer conditions, not applicable to cash activations.

RedemptionDate.description: The day on which a purchase fulfilled the offer.

TransactionAmount.description: Value of the purchase that fulfilled the offer, decimal is implied.

OfferId.description: System-wide identifier for the campaign, not intended for end-user display.

TotalAmountSaved.description: Combined value of purchased and redeemed deals.

TotalOffersUsed.description: Combined count of purchased and redeemed deals.

Token.description: Session identifier that is passed for subsequent API calls.
